Description: Shoulder sherd of probably Clazomenian black-figured pottery closed vessel, possibly an amphora; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of young boy holding a cock (only upper body and part of both arms of youth with added white for skin, fillet in added red in long black hair; only tail feathers of cock remaining), to left; below youth's right arm, part of a large bird, no doubt another, larger, cock (alternating red and white tail feathers alternating remaining); at right of figure, part of black handle zone.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p.254, no. 7)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.032) (Phase 1)
Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 139, no. 7)
Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 56)
Edgar 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis. B: The Inscribed and Painted Pottery (p. 61, no. 1. pl. VIII, no. 1)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School at Athens
